fields.description:
Mostly standalone but do also have a bare repository on our windows server, another at Bitbucket and another at GitHub.   I work alone so these are used to push to only.

FYI: GitHub app reports Error Failed looking for HEAD in this repository

The commit I was going to perform was very simple.  I had moved three files - and there was another - I made to changes to but the IDE had replaced the line endings to CRLF.

I included a snapshot of the SourceTree error message as well as the files it requested.

Thank you
Jim H

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>   Updated Information below

1.  FYI Today I had installed Git Extensions in my IDE

2.  I was checking Git log - and noticed the message for the last one was messed up - it began with my email address and was not complete.

I did a git commit --amend -m "new message" at the powershell prompt and that seemed to fix the commit.

SourceTree now opens fine.  So does gitk  (which would not open either)

How or why this happened - I have no clue.
fields.summary: Crashes on loading

fields.description: It would be good to be able to press Enter or Escape to dismiss the progress dialog once the operation (commit, push, pull etc.) has finished.
fields.summary: Make it possible to press Enter or Escape to close progress windows after the operation has completed

fields.description: Please support èéòàù characters
fields.summary: UTF8

fields.description: I want to use native ssh-keys instead of Pageant. Please support openssh key files.
fields.summary: Support openssh key files

fields.description:
When in the default view of SourceTree, the commit log and branch graph is shown in the top half and below that there are various panels, most notably the hunks view.
I would like to be able to detach these panels from the main window and have them as separate windows which I could then maximise on other monitors.
fields.summary: Make various GUI panels detachable as separate windows

fields.description:
Right now the SSH setup in ST4Win means that only key-based authentication is supported. This is because plink ignores the SSH_ASKPASS environment variable and doesn't call askpass. When you use a HTTPS URL, it's actually Git that calls the SSH_ASKPASS hook so manual authentication works.

Might need to fork plink to support this, or alternatively use TortoisePlink which provides its own version (although in that case saved passwords wouldn't be supported in the same way so that would be less effective)
fields.summary: Support manual SSH login (not key based)

fields.description: If a repository has a "CMD" directory, clicking on the "Terminal" button opens a window for the directory with "Explore.exe" instead of "Cmd.exe".
fields.summary: Terminal Opens "Explorer.exe" Instead of "Cmd.exe" if There Is a "CMD" Directory in the Repository

fields.description:
The Sourcetree UI on Windows isn't as nice as user would like to have it. I acknowledge the efforts and time you put into this project, but when comparing the Sourcetree UI on Windows to the Mac OSX screenshots, I'm a bit jealous.

The UI seems clunky, buttons are way too big, icons look like low quality GIF's w/o alpha transparency, pretty much every UI element has a gradient as background, highlighted text have often a blue background that is awkwardly big, some corners are rounded and others are not, UI elements are not aligned etc.

It works, but it isn't a joy to work with it yet. TortoiseHG proves that a simple but tidy UI is possible to implement on Windows. I would really appreciate if the Windows UI receives some love, even if that would mean to use the default Windows UI/WPF style or a clean VS2012 like design. I’m convinced that this would help in terms of perception and acceptance, because it’s the first impression that matters.
fields.summary: Overhaul the UI

fields.description: it seems to happen only if I use the commit search tab and then I go to the menu -> checkout...
fields.summary: Crash when menu checkout... item is selected

fields.description: Would like to have a place to add notes, todos, and whatnot for each branch.
fields.summary: A place for notes

fields.description:
I'm looking at switching from Git Extensions to SourceTree and one of the features I'm missing is the ability to add custom commands.  In Git Extensions I can add an external script configuration to do special operations.  These then show up as buttons with the name I choose.

A workaround is to use the terminal button and type in the command myself but this is just a workaround for a custom button feature.

It would be really nice if SourceTree had this feature.  Seems to be great otherwise.  Thanks!
fields.summary: Add Buttons to run scripts like Git Extensions

fields.description:
Clicking the "Reverse file" button I was getting an error each time (apply.png). Then the application just crashed (.log and .dump).

PS I was using the SourceTree app less than 3 minutes after the installation and had to remove it unfortunately. A good idea, but not really possible to use at the time. Also, it is VERY slow.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes

fields.description:
This is already in place in OS X version.
Since the window doesn't have a focus (SRCTREEWIN-317) it'd be useful to be able to close it with Esc at least.
fields.summary: Close progress/output window with Esc

fields.description: I switched to SourceTree and selected "working copy" to see my changes. I think it was on the log view before. It crashed. Notably my buttons across the top (commit, push, pull, etc.) had been missing since I started it.
fields.summary: crash

fields.description: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/152867/http-authentication-failure-on-push?page=1#153038
fields.summary: Username is incorrectly derived from URLs which include a port but not a username

fields.description:
Switched to a branch on the command line with the SourceTree GUI open and got the attached error.

As for the format of the dialog:  The caption of the dialog should be the name of the application (SourceTree).  The icon should be an error icon.  And lastly, the message gives no help as to what the user should do (or not do).

PS  While submitting you say: "Version with id '0.9.0.3' does not exist." but that is what the help about dialog says.
fields.summary: Summary failed

fields.description:
When doing a lot of UI ops with the mouse, it seems awkward to then have to go to the keyboard and hit F5, or use two clicks to go to View>>Refresh.

A refresh button on the toolbar would help here :)
fields.summary: Please add a Refresh button on the toolbar

fields.description: It would be nice if as you typed a commit message if you started to reference a file that has been staged, the dialog would suggest files that match what has been typed. TortoiseSVN does this and it's a very handy feature to describe changes made to specific files w/in a commit.
fields.summary: Add commit dialog suggest

fields.description: Right now as you type a commit message, instead of wrapping automatically the text area just scrolls to the right. This makes reading the full message harder then it should be.
fields.summary: Wrap commit message text

fields.description:
While having the app in the background I removed a repository from the filesystem. The repo was not opened in SourceTree, but it was present in the bookmarks tree.
When the focus to the app was restored I got these errors 3 or 4 times in a row (one after another in a loop) before being able to do anything.
fields.summary: Getting errors when restoring focus to app after repository removed

fields.description:
When attempting to commit, the dialog correctly appears, however the edit box is only 4 lines high.
I'll typically write roughly 10 lines worth of bullet points, or upgrade information for a commit message, and scrolling the box feels clunky.
It'd be nice if I could actually edit the size of this box myself via a splitter (much like every other area in the tool)
Thanks.
fields.summary: Commit details area too small and uneditable

fields.description: It seems that not everything is removed from the disk during the deletion process - the {{.git/objects}} folder is left behind with all its contents.
fields.summary: Removing a bookmark with "Delete Repositories on Disk" doesn't remove everything.

fields.description: Frequently get this error message when discarding or unstaging lines/hunks. Not sure exact steps to reproduce but it seems to be when I don't stage entire hunks. The "LastFailedPatch.txt" file mentioned in the error message does not exist.
fields.summary: 'git apply' failed with code 128: fatal: can't open patch

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be great to have a level of integration into Visual Studio for Source Tree, like GitExtensions has where you can do the following:

* From a code tab:
** Show Diff
** Show History
** Reset Changes on file
* From a toolbar:
** Change branches
** Create branch
** Bring up the commit dialog
** Stash changes

Thanks

James
fields.summary: Visual Studio Integration

fields.description:
Hi,

When work has finished on a feature branch it may contain a load of atomic commits that have no bearing on the living mainline, so when I merge it in I like to use the squash option so I end up with a working copy that has all the changes for that feature and then I can do a separate commit and give a nice commit message that encompasses that entire feature coming in off the branch.

This also allows me to revert the whole feature by reversing that commit.

For extra bonus points, if in the merge dialog, when you choose to squash, if you could give the option to create a new commit as well and a space for a commit message, that would be excellent.

Nice work on the tool, its interface is great, easy to use and is almost the best tool out there for Git.  Keep working on those features :)

Cheers

James.
fields.summary: When merging branches I would like to be able to squash my commits

fields.description:
Fonts get blurry when scrolling in a diff. I'm not much of a WPF developer, but please see:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4206166/visual-studio-2010-text-becoming-blurry-when-scrolling
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/text/archive/2009/08/24/wpf-4-0-text-stack-improvements.aspx
fields.summary: Blurry fonts when scrolling

fields.description: It seems that SRCTREE-1486 isn't implemented in the Windows app. When selecting multiple commits and right-clicking, all options are greyed out.
fields.summary: Cherry-picking multiple commits

fields.description:
I have some git repositories that were created with the --separate-git-dir flag (see https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-init.html) These are not recognized as valid by SourceTree. I have been using TortoiseGit to work with them but would like to switch.

When made this way, the main working folder contains a .git file that points to the real .git directory. For example, this setup could be created as:

cd \
git init --separate-git-dir foo-git foo

Then \foo would contain my files and \foo-git would contain the git files. This allows other tools that walk the directory tree from \foo to easily skip the git specific files.
fields.summary: support separate git dir

fields.description:
SourceTree cannot process Gloabl Git Ignore files which location has a "~" (eg. from Git Bash "~/.gitignore_global").

Would be nice to have a typical resolver for "~" (eg. identifying it with the value of the environment variable %userprofile%)
fields.summary: Resolve "~" When Detecting Git Global Ignore Files

fields.description:
In the log history view, the date column is showing the *actual* date a revision was committed, rather than the specified date that the commit was created with, i.e.

{code}
git commit --date '2007-06-05 12:34:56' -m 'test'
{code}

won't show 2007-06-05 12:34:56, it will show whatever the date/time is when you run the commit.

See attached screenshot.

Also, there's no option to choose the columns that you want to see in the log/history view.

The reason I'm using 0.8.5 is that for some reason the update mechanism isn't letting me update to 0.9, and a re-install doesn't fix it either.  It could be down to our firewall, but I'm not sure.
fields.summary: History window shows actual 'commit date' in date column rather than specified commit date.

fields.description:
The navigation view on the left side of the screen does not update when a tab is selected. This results in confusion as to what is the currently active repository in the main view.

We understand the double click functionality. We are not really asking a question but reporting a user interface bug.

When you switch tabs on the right side, the current highlighted workspace on the left does not update accordingly. This can lead to confusion when coming back to the app as to which workspace is currently active (since the tabs are much smaller than the left-hand navigation bar).
fields.summary: Left side navigation does not update selection

fields.description:
Allow the use of check boxes on the Commit dialog.

Checking a file in the "Working Copy Changes" pane would stage it.
Unchecking a file in the "Staged Changes" pane would unstage it.

Use the checkbox's "Indeterminate" (grayed out) state to signal to the user that a file is partially staged/unstaged.
fields.summary: In Commit dialog, with commit mode "Staged changes", allow use of checkboxes.

fields.description: I was merging conflicts and hit the crash. I think I'd just saved a merge from an external tool and sourcetree was refreshing its view after the tool closed.
fields.summary: Crash merging conflicting files

fields.description: Please add the possibility to sort all bookmarked repositories (e.g. for a folder) by name.
fields.summary: Automatical sorting of bookmarks

fields.description: I stored my GIT repositories in one parent folder. It would be nice to add a whole folder which then starts a grabber which goes trough all subfolders and adds all repositories included.
fields.summary: Add different repositories from one folder

fields.description: Not too difficult, you can already pass a -url parameter to clone. Add an option to read any paths from the command line, and if no parameters, use the current dir or parents if they are a repo.
fields.summary: Allow SourceTree to be launched from the command line

fields.description: On the FAQ, it states if you want to avoid typing in passphrases then you have to use Pageant. However it does not say that you must use it. Currently I can only pull/push and do anything else if and only if I have Pageant running. I would actually love to have the option to enter the passphrase every time. If I don't have it running an error returns "fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly".
fields.summary: Pageant should not be mandatory

fields.description:
Alaises in the git config file also give an error. You are forced to enter the full address to the repository.
Configuration:
Normal address: ssh://git@repo.com/repo.git
Alias address (using git config): repo:/repo.git
host repo
identityfile ~/.ssh/id_rsa
port 8090
user git
hostname repo.com
Error:
Unable to open connection:
Host does not existfatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

The workaround is to save sessions in PuTTY to use as aliases (as detailed on the [Answers thread|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/151000/how-do-i-configure-sourcetree-to-work-with-open-ssh-aliases-or-their-putty-style-equivalents]).

That will work, however not to bring up other Git clients, the norm is to have different options for authentication, those being PuTTy and Git Bash. By default SourceTree is configured to use Git Bash so I would expect it to use it for authentication as well. Maybe a feature request?
fields.summary: Use git bash for authentication

fields.description: Please add a folder view to the working copy tree. In large projects it is quite hard to find files in a non structured view.
fields.summary: Add folder structure to working copy tree

fields.description: Please remember the last commit mode selected (staged changes|selected files), because I prefer the "selected files" almost every time, but I know other people will prefer the default git behavior (stage->commit) and hide that on a setting would not be the best choice.
fields.summary: Commit: remember last commit mode for repo.

fields.description: Application crashes on load
fields.summary: Crash on launch

fields.description:
In all diff tools that I have, 3-way diff starts a merge operation.  This is not the desired effect and is preventing me from effectively working.

The staged changes should 2-way diff to parent, and working copy changes should 2-way diff to the staging area.
fields.summary: External Diff in working directory should not start a three way diff

fields.description:
Not sure when this happened as I don't often need it, but I've just needed it and it wasn't there.
Can't see any information in version history about this. 

FYI I'm using System Git.
fields.summary: Terminal button not visible

fields.description:
Support previewing of (common) image formats or display a message that no preview is available, instead of dumping the binary representation in the preview window.
I see no use for a binary dump of graphical images.
fields.summary: Support previewing of (common) image formats

fields.description:
I know there is a similar thread (SRCTREEWIN-286), but this feature is already present in the OS X version and I find it very helpful when the current branch is highlighted in bold in the sidebar.

I think the little tick icon overlay is a bit too little to distinguish it from others and from usability point of view I think it's just easier to look at the sidebar to see what is the current branch rather than looking at the bottom status/summary bar.
fields.summary: Make the current branch name displayed in bold in sidebar

fields.description: We've got large text files with large diffs. For instance 301 lines added, 2376 deleted. This takes ages to display a diff of - many seconds. We don't actually need to see the diff we just want to select the file to commit it! Having a bunch of these in the changes files, then selecting all the changes files can hang SourceTree for minutes.
fields.summary: SourceTree Diff View untenably slow with large files

fields.description:
As ignored in: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-376

This is not a "bug" in msysgit, as msysgit has already addressed the correct solution for this, which is to convert the backslashes in the path to forward slashes.  It's not necessarily the most politically correct solution, but git is a Linux tool and Linux does not like paths with backslashes, so it does make a kind of sense.  If you are waiting on msysgit to address this in a different manner you will be waiting an awfully long time as they have already addressed this issue as described.

This is also something that your other Windows git tool competitors all already handle correctly because they take Windows seriously.  Git Extensions does this.  TortoiseGit does this.  Etc.  They all handle Windows UNCs silently and without complaint by simply converting the path internally by replacing backslashes with forward slashes, which git expects and handles.  SourceTree is the only major tool which does not do this.

So if you would like to match your other competitors Windows git GUI tools by supporting Windows UNCs, a vital necessity to Windows uers, then all that you have to do is internally convert the path string with a simple find-and-replace of all backslashes to forward slashes.

Otherwise your Windows git tool competitors will all continue to have a significant compelling advantage over your Windows port of SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree for Windows does not handle UNCs

fields.description:
In the commit history view there are columns 'Graph', 'Description', 'Date', 'Author' and 'Comment'. 
If one hovers over the gaps betweeen the column headers a re-size cursor appears to resize the column left of the cursor.

This works between 'Graph' and 'Description' but not between 'Description' and 'Date'. Also resizing behavior between 'Date' and 'Author' is unintuitive.
fields.summary: Column resize behaves strangely

fields.description: The expected behavior of dragging text is to drag-select.  This should happen for the selected lines in the diff hunks in the commit dialog.
fields.summary: Support drag-select in commit dialog hunks

fields.description:
"Add to index" should be "Stage File", to match all other buttons.
"Remove" should be "Delete", to match the Windows nomenclature.
"Discard" should be "Discard Changes" to emphasize that the changes will be reverted.
fields.summary: Commit dialog file context menu text improvements

fields.description:
The installer can not launched.

The install.log file content:
The following properties have been set:
Property: [AdminUser] = true {boolean}
Property: [InstallMode] = HomeSite {string}
Property: [NTProductType] = 1 {int}
Property: [ProcessorArchitecture] = AMD64 {string}
Property: [VersionNT] = 6.1.1 {version}
Running checks for package 'Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 (x86 and x64)', phase BuildList
Reading value 'Version' of registry key 'HKLM\Software\Microsoft\NET Framework Setup\NDP\v4\Full'
Read string value '4.5.50709'
Setting value '4.5.50709 {string}' for property 'DotNet45Full_TargetVersion'
The following properties have been set for package 'Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 (x86 and x64)':
Property: [DotNet45Full_TargetVersion] = 4.5.50709 {string}
Running checks for command 'DotNetFX45\dotNetFx45_Full_x86_x64.exe'
Result of running operator 'ValueEqualTo' on property 'InstallMode' and value 'HomeSite': true
Result of checks for command 'DotNetFX45\dotNetFx45_Full_x86_x64.exe' is 'Bypass'
Running checks for command 'DotNetFX45\dotNetFx45_Full_setup.exe'
Result of running operator 'ValueNotEqualTo' on property 'InstallMode' and value 'HomeSite': false
Result of running operator 'VersionGreaterThanOrEqualTo' on property 'DotNet45Full_TargetVersion' and value '4.5.50709': true
Result of checks for command 'DotNetFX45\dotNetFx45_Full_setup.exe' is 'Bypass'
'Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 (x86 and x64)' RunCheck result: No Install Needed
Launching Application.
URLDownloadToCacheFile failed with HRESULT '-2146697208'
Error: An error occurred trying to download 'http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTree.application'.

fields.description:
This works:
\\\\msnfile\GlobalShare\Arah\GitTest

This does not work:
\\msnfile\GlobalShare\Arah\GitTest
fields.summary: Can't clone UNC path

fields.description:
SourceTree is not automatically restarted on Windows 7 32-bit after updating.
It worked few updates ago, and it still works on Windows 8 64-bit.
I think it last worked for 0.8.3 or 0.8.4 update
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't restart after updating to new version

fields.description: I am new using source tree and I do some things using the command line, but not in the shell opened when pressing the Terminal button. I was working in SourceTree. I switched to a command shell and deleted a working branch in three local repositories. I then recreated a branch with the same name from a different commit. When I switched back to SourceTree, it crashed.
fields.summary: Crash in SourceTree for Windows 0.9.0.2

fields.description:
It would be nice if clicking on a bookmarked repository would automatically open (and set focus) to the tab on the right.

Making this a user controllable setting might be nice for users that don't want this behavior.
fields.summary: Auto-open repository tab when clicking on bookmark

fields.description: It would be nice if there was an option during install to select the drive to install to.  I have a pretty small solid state for my OS, and almost was unable to install SourceTree because of it. To clarify, I almost wasn't able because I need the remainder of space (~5gb) for silly windows updates...
fields.summary: Source Tree doesn't allow for selecting drive during install.

fields.description:
In Windows, it is not possible to select an individual file if it has already been selected with a CTRL or SHIFT. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Select "Working Copy" in a repository and "Show All".
# Hold CTRL (or SHIFT) and select a few (or all) files in the "Working Copy Changes".
# Release CTRL (or SHIFT) and attempt to select one of the files already selected.
fields.summary: Multi Selection Not Working Properly

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Open the "Clone/Add/Create Repository" dialog.
# On the "Clone Repository" tab, type in the path to a slow repository. 
# Click on the "Destination Path:" field.
# When focus is transferred, SourceTree has not yet confirmed that the target is a valid repository so the "Clone" button remains disabled, as expected.
# After a few seconds, SourceTree confirms that the target is indeed a valid repository. However, [the "Clone" button remains disabled|^screenshot1.png] until focus leaves the "Destination Path:" field.
fields.summary: "Clone" Button is Not Enabled Until Change of Focus When Confirming Repository Validity

fields.description: It would be nice to use PowerShell as the default terminal. PowerShell is great for managing GIT from the commandline (especially when using Posh-Git).
fields.summary: Allow PowerShell as the default terminal

fields.description:
When using the SourceTree auto-updater, the icons in the icon bar are missing after SourceTree restarts (see attachment).

They can be restored by restarting SourceTree manually after the update is finished.
fields.summary: Icon bar empty after SourceTree updates

fields.description: Although we should be detecting password failure & re-prompting properly anyway (SRCTREEWIN-331), it would be useful to provide people a way to see/update their cached usernames and passwords anyway. Authentication tab in Preferences with 2 lists is probably the way to go.
fields.summary: Allow manual editing of stored user/passwords

fields.description:
We had a couple of people on Twitter who were annoyed because we installed a default global ignore file.

We actually only install a global ignore file by default if the user has none configured already, and we also show this in the wizard as a checkbox which they can turn off. Still, clearly not everyone spots this and would prefer not to have had a global ignore file installed.

Remove the option from the wizard page and instead pop up a message box which says 'We noticed you don't have a global ignore file, would you like us to install one that ignores <blah>?'. That way they can't miss it.
fields.summary: Make global git ignore install option more obvious

fields.description:
Currently when you searching some text by File Changes criteria, it shows you only commits, that matches, but gives you no information where in the commit this information contains.

It should show at least file, that matched, or better higlighting where this text was found.
fields.summary: Search by "File Changes" should highlight result files/text

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be good to be able to re-size the delete branch dialog because it only shows a handful of branches.

Thanks

James
fields.summary: Branch - Delete Branch dialog ,should be resizable

fields.description: Branches with underscores in their name are displayed incorrectly in context menus. I have observed this in the main window by right-clicking on a branch or a remote. I have also observed this in the merge window when clicking on the "Jump to:" menu. This seems to only be cosmetic as the menu items appear to function correctly. I have attached a screencap of the context menu from the main window. The actual branch name is VERSION_10_STABLE but it is displayed as VERSION10_STABLE.
fields.summary: Branch names displayed incorrectly

fields.description:
Would be great if lastly used commit mode would be selected by default for next commits.

I mostly commit with "Selected files" mode, but every time I come back to commit window it defaults back to "Staged changes".
fields.summary: Commit mode is not persisted between different commits

fields.description:
As a user who often has many repos open at the same time and may have uncommitted changes in more than one, it would be helpful to have a visual cue on the tab that there are uncommitted changes.

A step further would be to have some sort of cue that a local branch that has a remote branch being tracked is ahead of the remote (i.e., I need to push)
fields.summary: Add visual cue for repos that have uncommitted changes

fields.description:
I am able to get to our stash install that's currently hosted externally via web browser. I have a proxy set up through the OS itself.

When I try to clone/pull behind the proxy with sourcetree, I'm unable to. Perhaps this is an underlying git on windows problem though. When I take my laptop home and disable the proxy I am able to clone etc.
fields.summary: Proxy Support

fields.description:
I have my own id_rsa & id_rsa.pub keys in my home folder.

The id_rsa.pub is also set into my account in gerrit. I'm using gerrit ssh deamon to connect to git (by default port 29418).

using git bash (and so ssh.exe) url with username is correctly cloned (ssh://myusername@mycompany:29418/module) but when I don't set username (ssh://mycompany:29418/module) it no more works.

To make it works with ssh://myusername@mycompany:29418/module, it was still needed to convert my private key into putty format (see my answer here : https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/85262/connecting-to-remote-git-via-ssh-fails-sourcetree-sends-wrong-username )

All this will not be an issue if I was not working with submodule. The thing is when working with submodule url stored in .gitmodule doesn't contains username (because everyone should be able to clone submodule).


This issue seems to be due to putty usage, when using ssh.exe provide with git binairies all works well.

I don't know if it can be fixed on putty, but may you can do the same as Git Extension does and let the user choose between putty usage or OpenSSH (ssh.exe) for ssh implementation.
fields.summary: repository set without username in url can't be cloned, and so submodule will never work at all

fields.description:
Use case: when misspelling a username to access a repository (eg. Bitbucket) it is not possible to change it in SourceTree. The authentication window pops up, [the username is wrong and the text field can't be selected|^screenshot1.jpg].

To change you need to go the depth of Windows and change it in "userhosts".

Would be nice to have this simplified.
fields.summary: Simpler Change of Credentials

fields.description: creating a new repository from an IBM Notes ( previously Lotus Notes ) On Disk Project
fields.summary: Git Crashed due to long file names from IBM ( Lotus ) Notes

fields.description: Mac version of Source Tree supports git flow already. I think that implementation of git flow in Windows version could become one of the killer features that none of competitors have.
fields.summary: Git Flow Support

fields.description:
It would be nice if the commit graph could support saved, user defined 'views' that did not result in checking out source into the repository. I'd really like to be able to specify 'git log' command options and have the resulting log entries graphed within SourceTree as a way to graphically have different views into the log. 

For example, if I have three features A,B,C delivered into release branch R1 and three other issues X,Y,Z delivered into branch R2 and R1 merges into R2 I'd like to be able to see the graph for 'git log R1..R2' to see the changes in R2 that are not in R1 (XYZ).
fields.summary: Graph browsing views (without checking out source)

fields.description: It'd be really handy to have an "Open SourceTree Here" option integrated into the Windows File Explorer context menu.
fields.summary: Context menu integration in Windows explorer

fields.description:
Something to provide:

* frictionless switching between profile/identify when performing actions against a repository
* clear visibility of the currently active profile/identity at all times

For a basic implementation, something like the provided wireframe is what I have in mind.

Going further with the idea, it would be ideal if SourceTree supported a list of identities globally and allowed setting overrides per-repository. For example I would set my formal profile for work projects and a pseudonym profile for personal open source projects, and it would remember the difference between them so I don't accidentally commit changes to a work repository under a pseudonym.
fields.summary: Easily accessible "Identity" selector

fields.description:
It would be handy if the "Terminal" button on the toolbar was configurable.
For example I hardly ever use the Git bash shell directly, I use Powershell with posh-git. Likewise for Mercurial.
fields.summary: Configurable "Terminal" link

fields.description:
It's annoying having to uncheck this option everytime I want to fetch.

I don't want to fetch from all remotes by default because some of them are very slow, like my colleagues' git repos accessed through windows shares.
fields.summary: Remember check box status for "Fetch from all remotes" in the Fetch dialog

fields.description: Running SourceTree for Windows. Opening first local git repo.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crash

fields.description: Program crashed after switching to "Log/History" tab and now crashes every time I start up.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashing

fields.description:
* Downloaded and installed ST for Windows. First time install.
* Was offered and accepted installation of .Net framework 4.5.
* Computer rebooted.
* Offered and accepted installation of Git as no Git on the computer
* Attempted to clone a known, working Hg repo from Bitbucket.org
* Error "This is not a valid source path / URL".
* Tried with a different Hg repo from bitbucket.org.  Same issue.

Screen shot attached of message from clicking on error "Details" button.
fields.summary: Fatal error on cloning Hg repo from bitbucket

fields.description: "1 sty 0001 0:00" is visible in the "Date" column during the loading process of the commits list. ["sty" is an abbreviation from "styczeń", January in Polish]
fields.summary: "Zero" date visible while loading the commits list

fields.description: It would be nice to configure the author column to display one or both of (author username, author email).
fields.summary: Option to configure author column

fields.description: When blaming a file at a non-HEAD commit, it is not obvious that you are viewing a different state. The blame view should include some basic commit information (hash, timestamp, commiter).
fields.summary: Blame view should include last commit information

fields.description:
When using the "Log Selected..." or "Blame Selected..." right-click options, these actions will open a new window. These dialogs can have a decent amount of state and information in them, and this behavior is irritating: you're now re-sizing a separate window and losing the ability to quickly switch back to other views.

I would advocate changing the default to open a new tab, and adding an option to keep the old behavior (I can see users with multiple monitors desiring this, for example).
fields.summary: File blame and log actions should open new tabs, not windows

fields.description: It's impossible to change width of "Description" column. Also, during changing width of the other columns, the size is being changed in a weird way.
fields.summary: Changing width of the columns

fields.description:
One of the more important features I would want from a Git GUI is a way to trivially view the repository (or a specific file) at any commit. I could not find this functionality if it exists.

Suggestions:
* In the Log/History tab, add a right-click -> "View Tree..." option, which shows a list of files at that commit
* Ability to view, open in default editor (export file to %temp% folder), and Save As (export file to user-defined folder)
fields.summary: Ability to view full file tree at arbitrary commit

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to just do a single click and to stage all of the files. Git extensions has this feature, and I miss it.

At the moment you have to select all and drag all in, or right click and "Add to Index".
fields.summary: Add Staging buttons to commit window (like Git Extensions)

fields.description:
If you rewrite your history and want to push these commit, you can't push because there is nowhere an option to '--force' the push.

You should open a console and do it by command line :(
fields.summary: Add an option to do a 'git push' with '--force' option

fields.description:
It would be nice if a middle click on a tab would close the tab.
In the same vein, adding a right click menu in tab bar containing menus like :

 * Close
 * Close all
 * Close all but this

Would be nice.
fields.summary: New tab bar features

fields.description: For very simple repository SourceTree ate about 700Mb.
fields.summary: SourceTree consumes huge amounts of memory

fields.description:
I changed a file on the HDD but the icon stayed green in ST
It was not until I selected all files and dragged them to the staging area that ST recognised it was not a clean file
See image attached
The report a Help > report bug link in ST beta used to go to a dedicated bug tracker - this seems to have changed - hence why I ended up here
fields.summary: Dirty files not showing as dirty in Windows ST Beta .8.5.1

fields.description:
The application crash shortly after deleting some very old stashes that had been laying around for some time.  I believe that I had clicked on the working branch after deleting the stashes when the crash occurred.

NULL REFERENCE OF DOOM
fields.summary: Crash Occurred [After] Deleting Multiple Stashes

fields.description:
Haven't checked out the 0.9 version yet (temporary lack access to a Windows machine), but in 0.8.x it was not possible to deselect committed files when amending the last commit - the list of files was empty, only commit message is/was editable.

Apologies if this is fixed in 0.9.
fields.summary: Commit window with "Amend" ticked should allow unselecting files committed

fields.description: It seems like source tree doesn't handle failed authentications well.  I entered my password incorrectly, and it tried three times to authenticate using that bad password.  Subsequent attempts to push in that session all failed, source tree never prompted again.  After restart source tree it did finally prompt, but it never allowed me to reenter my username, only my password.
fields.summary: Difficulties when authentication fails

fields.description: Getting really slow (90 seconds to update) performance when switching between commits in the main window. On investigation it appears that SourceTree is attempting to contact www.gravatar.com to obtain a gravatar for the commit. This address is inaccessible from my network and there doesn't appear to be a way of turning off this lookup.
fields.summary: Slow performance with no Internet Connectivity

fields.description: When I clicked reverse on a file, the program crashed.
fields.summary: Crashes when attempting to reverse a file

fields.description:
WPF is very smart in that you can give it a collection of objects and implement styles to render them to your needs. However it seems that when these collections get very large, their efficiency suffers and particularly in the diff view this can cause performance issues, exacerbated by the fact that WPF always runs in the main thread (so even though we're doing all our work in background threads to avoid stalling the UI, WPF can still cause stalls in the user experience).

Investigate ways to improve this. Virtualisation can help, but has drawbacks too (we have used it in places but have had to use shims to keep things like selections working consistently). A more extreme solution might be to just manually render the diff view instead of using WPF's stylings to do it (quite a bit of work). For the moment the workarounds keep things mostly acceptable (limiting diff size for added/removed/untracked files) but there are edge cases which are noticably slow, like very large diffs caused by line ending conversions or automated tools.

See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-310 for one instance of this.
fields.summary: WPF performance issues with large collections with custom styles
Crashed when clicking on a commit log item

fields.description:
Every time I change from one branch, to another in big repository's it keeps certain files in the folder that then get called as changes to the target repository.
How do I get it to remove files from the folder that aren't in the target branch?
fields.summary: Change branch keeps random files from other branch
